channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Your Samsung Fridge ls Also Getting Ads Soon
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.description: Everyone was asking for this, or something.
item.content:encoded: You have ads on your phone, your TV, your computer, and pretty much every electronic in your house. Now, Samsung wants to make your kitchen into free ad real estate, too.

item.title: Anker’s Recalled Batteries Caused Fires and 'Substantial Property Damage'
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Check the list and replace any recalled models.
item.content:encoded: With how popular portable battery packs are, when a bunch of packs suddenly start catching fire, it's a pretty big deal. In June, Anker announced a recall on over a million battery packs, then added five more models to the list a few weeks later "out of an abundance of caution." After further investigation, some of these certainly carry a risk, so this is your reminder to dispose of and replace any affected units.

item.title: This Corsair Mouse Weighs Only 36 Grams
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.content:encoded: Corsair makes a lot of different PC gaming hardware, light and heavy. This mouse that the company has just released is so light, it might actually be too light for many of you.

item.title: Maximizing Value and Avoiding Regret in Your Car Purchase: Top Things to Consider
item.dc:creator: Brent vd Schyff
item.description: Skyrocketing new car prices driven by tariffs, interest rates, and depreciation. Discover the key factors to consider before buying your next vehicle.
item.content:encoded: Arguably, one of the biggest purchases you will make in your life will be acquiring a car. The decision is overshadowed by factors that one may or may not be too cognizant of. New car prices are reaching all-time highs, and every possible hurdle is hitting the average costs across the board. Tariff impacts affecting all manufacturers are a present danger, but higher interest rates go further to complicate things, affecting not just finance arrangements but manufacturers who need to import raw materials and components used in the manufacturing process. It's a dire time.

item.title: Get a MagSafe Cable for 29% Off Today
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: A nice deal for a 6-foot cable.
item.content:encoded: Today, you can grab a MagSafe Charger for your iPhone or AirPods for a surprisingly low price of just $35 on Amazon. This is a big 29% discount from its normal price of $49. This is the lowest price so far for the MagSafe Charger, which is a great deal considering its impressive 25W fast-charging.

item.title: Heres How I Made iOS 26 Look More Like iOS 18
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.content:encoded: iOS 26 is out now as a free upgrade for compatible iPhones, and with it comes Apple’s new Liquid Glass aesthetic. So what if you don’t like what Apple has done with your iPhone?

item.title: Linux Mint Debian Edition 7 Just Got Its First Beta Release
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: With a shiny new Debian 13 codebase.
item.content:encoded: Linux Mint just announced the beta release for LMDE 7, codenamed "Gigi." The beta release is available now, and you can download it from a variety of mirrors around the world. One of the more interesting things about this beta is that the root account is locked by default.

item.title: Add a User to a Group (or Second Group) on Linux
item.dc:creator: Chris Hoffman
Jordan Gloor
item.description: Groups are a handy way to help keep permissions and ownership organized.
item.content:encoded: Changing the group a user is associated to is a fairly easy task, but not everybody knows the commands, especially to add a user to a secondary group. We'll walk through all the scenarios for you.

item.title: Google Chrome's Gemini Revamp Has Me Worried
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: Finally, a web browser that tells me to eat glue and rocks.
item.content:encoded: Google Chrome has slowly accumulated more generative AI features over the last two years, and now even more of them are on the way. Google has announced deeper integration with its Gemini AI assistant, including an “agent browsing assistant” that will attempt to automate online tasks.

item.title: I Use These Smart Home Routines Every Day, Here's Why
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: I can't imagine life without them.
item.content:encoded: Are you intimidated by setting up smart home routines? I’ve gone down the rabbit hole and set up quite a few around my house. Some are complex, and some do just one thing. Here are my favorite smart home automations and how I use them.
